perturbation.original_text:
16.  PAYMENT OF TRANSPORTATION CHARGES:
Subject to any provisions to the contrary in a TSA between Carrier and Shipper:


A.	Shipper or Consignee shall pay, as provided below, all applicable transportation and other charges (including any deficiency payments
set out in a TSA) accruing on Products handled by Carrier.


B.	All payments are due on the later of: (1) within fifteen (15) days of receipt of the invoice; (2) the twenty-seventh (27th) of the month
following receipt of the invoice, or; (3) if the twenty-seventh (27th) of the month following receipt of the invoice is not a Business Day,
on the next Business Day thereafter.
perturbation.changed_text:
16.  PAYMENT OF TRANSPORTATION CHARGES:
Subject to any provisions to the contrary in a TSA between Carrier and Shipper:


A.	Shipper or Consignee shall pay, as provided below, all applicable transportation and other charges (including any deficiency payments
set out in a TSA) accruing on Products handled by Carrier.


B.	All payments are due at the sole discretion of the Carrier. The Carrier will determine the payment schedule on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies the due date of payments, creating a clear obligation. The modified version introduces ambiguity by stating that payments are due at the sole discretion of the Carrier, which contradicts the prior clarity and creates uncertainty regarding when payment is actually expected. This could allow Carrier to demand immediate payment, even if this contradicts general industry standards.

perturbation.original_text:
15.1 Compliance with Laws. Both Parties shall, in carrying out the terms and provisions of this Agreement, abide by all present and future
laws of any Governmental Authorities.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.1 Compliance with Laws. Both Parties may, at their own discretion, choose to abide by all present and future laws of any Governmental Authorities.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates compliance with all applicable laws. The modification introduces optionality, suggesting that compliance is not obligatory. This directly contradicts the principle of adhering to laws and regulations, and creates ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text:
16.1 Restrictions on Assignment. This Agreement may not be assigned, disposed of, alienated or otherwise transferred by either Party, in
whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed,
except as provided below.
perturbation.changed_text:
16.1 Restrictions on Assignment. This Agreement may be assigned, disposed of, alienated or otherwise transferred by either Party, in
whole or in part, even without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall be given at the discretion of the assignor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires written consent from the other party for assignment, disposal, alienation or transfer of the agreement. The changed text introduces a contradiction where consent from the other party is not needed. This will create ambiguity and uncertainty as to when the agreement needs approval from the other party.
